title: Facial Anatomy and Cosmetic Procedure Skills Education Based on the ADDAPT Model

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Understanding of Human Anatomy and Interest in the Beauty Industry
context.additional_context: Contextual learning applying the ADDAPT model (Assess & Aware, Demonstrate, Decode, Act & Accomplish, Perform, Teach & Test) in a mobile environment using digital devices, with a formative assessment-centered feedback system.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately identify and explain the major structures of facial anatomy (muscles, nerves, blood vessels) by applying the 6 steps of the ADDAPT model.
Learners can plan safe application sites and depths for non-invasive cosmetic procedures (e.g., Botox, fillers) using digital simulation tools.
Learners can improve the accuracy of cosmetic procedure skills by over 20% through peer assessment and practical feedback.
Learners can achieve cumulative certification by mastering over 85% of weekly learning content through formative assessments (quizzes, submission of practice videos).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
